oai_dc:dc.dc:title: S.H. Kress building, Nashville, Tennessee, 1935 October 18
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of the construction of the S.H. Kress & Co. building, a project of the Foster & Creighton Co. Contractors. The S.H. Kress Co. opened its impressive five-story “dime store” on Feb. 18th, 1936 at 237 Fifth Ave. N in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. This art deco building, with its terra-cotta brick front, was designed by the New York architect, Edward F. Sibbert. Forms part of the Foster & Creighton General Contractors Collection. 1 b & w photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: S.H. Kress & Co.
